meanings.definition: relating to or affected by atresia
meanings.sent1: The atresial condition of the blocked artery required immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the atresial nature of the closed valve in the heart.
meanings.sent3: The atresial door stubbornly refused to open, causing a comical situation.
meanings.sent4: Her atresial mind was like a locked box, keeping her thoughts hidden.
meanings.sent5: The atresial barrier between them seemed insurmountable, like an unbreakable wall.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the abnormal closure or absence of a natural passage in the body
meanings.sent1: The atresial tube in his ear caused hearing difficulties.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon discussed the atresial condition of the blocked intestine.
meanings.sent3: The atresial road sign led to confusion among the drivers, creating a funny scene.
meanings.sent4: Her atresial heartache felt like a closed-off room, isolating her from others.
meanings.sent5: The atresial tunnel was a dark, impassable void, like a forgotten passage in a maze.
